original: /'o na rang byin gyis brlab pa ni khams gsum pa mthong ba nyid du gsungs pa de mthong ba las de mi ldog pa'i phyir des na 'khor ba gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas nyid ji lta bu dang 'dra bar srid par 'gyur zhe na
analyzed: /'o na rang byin gyis brlab pa ni khams gsum pa mthong ba nyid du gsungs pa de mthong ba las de mi ldog pa'i phyir des na 'khor ba gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas nyid ji lta bu dang 'dra bar srid par 'gyur zhe na

original: / gsungs pa 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: / gsungs pa 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: It is said:

original: 'khor ba khams gsum pa snying po med pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can la sangs rgyas nyid de de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba khams gsum pa snying po med pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can la sangs rgyas nyid de de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid dang /
translated: Samsara, the three realms, which is essenceless, false, and deceptive, is the result, the essence, of buddhahood, which is omniscience, knowledge of all things, knowledge of the path, knowledge of the aspects of the path,

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam @58b bar yon tan 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bras bu ste snying por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam @58b bar yon tan 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bras bu ste snying por 'gyur ro //
translated: and the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and so forth, which are characterized by the wealth of good qualities.

original: de zad las te 'khor ba zad pa las so //
analyzed: de zad las te 'khor ba zad pa las so //
translated: It is exhausted by karma, by the exhaustion of samsara.

original: de 'khor ba zad pa'i bar mchod du ci dang 'dra bar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de 'khor ba zad pa'i bar mchod du ci dang 'dra bar 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is it like that arises until the end of cyclic existence?

original: chu shing gi 'bras bu bzhin dang 'dra bar zhes pa ste ji ltar snying po med pa'i chu shing la snying po 'bras bu smin pa chu shing nyams pas yang dag 'byung ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas nyid kyang ngo zhes pa'o //

translated: It is like the fruit of the plantain tree. Just as the fruit of the plantain tree, which has no core, arises from the destruction of the plantain tree, so also is buddhahood.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa byang chub kyi sems su 'dod na de kho na nyid ni de kho na nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'o zhes pa'i gsungs las /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa byang chub kyi sems su 'dod na de kho na nyid ni de kho na nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'o zhes pa'i gsungs las /
translated: Now, if it is accepted that the enlightenment mind which is the means of establishing buddhahood, then, according to the statement, “Reality is established by reality itself,”🔽since it is born from illusion, illusion is ignorance, and how could that which is the field of its engagement be the means of establishing buddhahood?🔽He says:🔽Sin is the worm,🔽the crab is the crab,

original: de yang sgyu ma las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma ni ma rig pa yin la des 'jug pa'i lo de ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis sgrub par byed par 'gyur bar 'os she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma ni ma rig pa yin la des 'jug pa'i lo de ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis sgrub par byed par 'gyur bar 'os she na gsungs pa /
translated: the fish is the fish,🔽the tortoise is the tortoise,🔽the snake is the snake,🔽the frog is the frog,🔽the elephant is the elephant,🔽the horse is the horse,🔽the donkey is the donkey,🔽the camel is the camel,🔽the man is the man,🔽the woman is the woman,🔽the boy is the boy,🔽the girl is the girl,🔽the tree is the tree,🔽the mountain is the mountain,🔽the house is the house,🔽the village is the village,🔽the town is the town,🔽the city is the city,🔽the country is the country,🔽the earth is the earth,

original: sdig pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the water is the water,🔽the fire is the fire,🔽the wind is the wind,🔽the sky is the sky,🔽the sun is the sun,🔽the moon is the moon,🔽the stars are the stars,🔽the body is the body,🔽the speech is the speech,🔽the mind is the mind,🔽the eye is the eye,🔽the ear is the ear,🔽the nose is the nose,

original: sdig pa ni sh'u ka'i srin bu'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni sh'u ka'i srin bu'o //
translated: the tongue is the tongue,🔽the body is the body,🔽the form is the form,🔽the sound is the sound,🔽the smell is the smell,🔽the taste is the taste,🔽the touch is the touch,🔽the phenomena are the phenomena,🔽the eye consciousness is the eye consciousness,🔽the ear consciousness is the ear consciousness,🔽the nose consciousness is the nose consciousness,🔽the tongue consciousness is the tongue consciousness,🔽the body consciousness is the body consciousness,🔽the mental consciousness is the mental consciousness,🔽the aggregates are the aggregates,

original: ku l'i ra ni karka ta'o //
analyzed: ku l'i ra ni karka ta'o //
translated: the constituents are the constituents,🔽the sense bases are the sense bases,🔽the perfections are the perfections,🔽the factors

original: gang gi skabs las byung zhing 'byung bar nang gi sgya  ma de rnams kyis nyams par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin zhes pa de ltar rnal 'byor gyi sems te rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi skabs las byung zhing 'byung bar nang gi sgya  ma de rnams kyis nyams par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin zhes pa de ltar rnal 'byor gyi sems te rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Yoga is the union of means and wisdom.

original: de la yod pa'i sems ni dbang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa'i sems ni dbang bzhi pa ste /
translated: The mind that exists there is the fourth empowerment.

original: gang sgyu ma ma rig ba 'pho ba'i chos can gyi skabs las kun rdzob tu skyes pa yin zhing de rnam par nyams par byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang sgyu ma ma rig ba 'pho ba'i chos can gyi skabs las kun rdzob tu skyes pa yin zhing de rnam par nyams par byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The illusion that is the subject of the transference of ignorance is born conventionally from the context of its arising, and it will be destroyed.

original: sgyu ma dang bral ba na 'khor ba slar ldog pa med par brjod de de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams dbugs dbang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang bral ba na 'khor ba slar ldog pa med par brjod de de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams dbugs dbang ba'i don du'o //
translated: When free from illusion, samsara is said to be reversed, for the yogis of reality are empowered with the breath.

original: 'o na byang chub kyi sems ni bems po'i khams su 'dir brjod la de yang bems bo ma yin pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes sangs rgyas nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ji ltar brjod ce na khu bar 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis mchog
analyzed: 'o na byang chub kyi sems ni bems po'i khams su 'dir brjod la de yang bems bo ma yin pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes sangs rgyas nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ji ltar brjod ce na khu bar 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis mchog
translated: Now, if it is said that the bodhicitta is described here as the element of matter, and that also is not matter, but is established by the Buddha himself as the supreme unchanging gnosis, how is it described?

original: tu mi 'gyur ba sgrub par byed ces pa'i gsung gi phyir ro //
analyzed: tu mi 'gyur ba sgrub par byed ces pa'i gsung gi phyir ro //
translated: It is said that the supreme unchanging is established by the nature of the unchanging semen.🔽For that very reason, this yoga of reality, the bodhicitta, is said to have sixteen aspects by the nature of the supreme unchanging.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid rnal 'byor gyi sems 'di'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bos bcu drug bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid rnal 'byor gyi sems 'di'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bos bcu drug bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nondual, etc., is stated.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems te de gang la yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems te de gang la yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The so-called two are the mind of samsara and nirvana, which do not exist in it.

original: nor bu dang padma las g-yo ba med pa'o zhes pa g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: nor bu dang padma las g-yo ba med pa'o zhes pa g-yo ba med do //
translated: It is said to be unmoving, not moving from the jewel and lotus.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ste shes rab @59a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ste shes rab @59a * //
translated: It is the movement, the wisdom.

original: dang thabs kyi bdag nyid 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rjes 'gro med do //
analyzed: dang thabs kyi bdag nyid 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rjes 'gro med do //
translated: The non-existence of this [union] is the absence of the subsequent [thought].

original: bla na med pa'i bde ba rab tu sbyin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'o zhes rnal 'byor bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bde ba rab tu sbyin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'o zhes rnal 'byor bzhi pa'o //
translated: It is desired because it bestows the highest bliss. This is the fourth yoga.

original: brgya phrag drug lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis dbugs 'gog pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brgya phrag drug lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis dbugs 'gog pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is supremely unchanging because it stops the breath in twenty-one thousand and six hundred [places].

original: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i phyogs dkar po dang nag po zhes pa dag gis gnas dang bgrod pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i phyogs dkar po dang nag po zhes pa dag gis gnas dang bgrod pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'o //
translated: It is great passion because it is free from the white and black aspects of passion and dispassion, and because it is free from abiding and movement.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa las nges par grol ba nyid kyi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa las nges par grol ba nyid kyi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free from existence and non-existence because it is liberated from form and formlessness.

original: shes bya ma lus pa mthong ba'i phyir ye shes so zhes pa rnal 'byor gsum pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya ma lus pa mthong ba'i phyir ye shes so zhes pa rnal 'byor gsum pa'o //
translated: It is wisdom because it sees all objects of knowledge. This is the third yoga.

original: 'gro ba dga' bar byed pa sngon ma nyid kyi phyir ram chags pa med pa nyid kyi phyir sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dga' bar byed pa sngon ma nyid kyi phyir ram chags pa med pa nyid kyi phyir sems dpa'o //
translated: He is a hero because he delights beings as never before, or because he is free of attachment.

original: dang po dang bar dang tha mar dge ba byed pa nyid kyi phyir kun du bzang po'o //🔽bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sgra ste grags pa phyi dang nang gi brjod pa'am yang na rab tu sgrogs shing rnam par lhod pa'i seng ge'i sgra can gyi g-yul 'di la yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa sgra 'thab
analyzed: dang po dang bar dang tha mar dge ba byed pa nyid kyi phyir kun du bzang po'o // bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sgra ste grags pa phyi dang nang gi brjod pa'am yang na rab tu sgrogs shing rnam par lhod pa'i seng ge'i sgra can gyi g-yul 'di la yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa sgra 'thab
translated: He is Samantabhadra because he acts virtuously in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: pa med pa'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'o //
translated: He is without sound, because he is free of Mara, the afflictions, and discursive thought. He is without the sound of the battle of the external and internal expressions of fame, or else he is without the sound of the battle of the lion's roar, which is proclaimed and then abandoned.

original: gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di'i sgra ste grags pa chen po'o zhes pas sgra che ba'o zhes pa rnal 'byor gnyis pa'o //🔽'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di'i sgra ste grags pa chen po'o zhes pas sgra che ba'o zhes pa rnal 'byor gnyis pa'o // 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: He is of great sound because his sound, his fame, is of the nature of an invincible sound.

original: lhan skyes so //
analyzed: lhan skyes so //
translated: He is innate because he is free of worldly conduct.

original: sku bzhi'i sgrib pa zad ba'i phyir dpal byang chub sems kyi thig le 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sku bzhi'i sgrib pa zad ba'i phyir dpal byang chub sems kyi thig le 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the holder of the glorious bindu of bodhicitta because the obscurations of the four kāyas are exhausted.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir dpal dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir dpal dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje'o //
translated: He is the glorious Vajra of the Wheel of Time because emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: tshul khrims kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor ro zhes pa rnal 'byor dang po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor ro zhes pa rnal 'byor dang po'o //
translated: He is the yoga of the nature of wisdom and method because the accumulation of moral discipline is perfectly complete.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor de 'di kho na rgyud thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams la nges par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnal 'byor de 'di kho na rgyud thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams la nges par bstan to //
translated: This yoga of the nature of wisdom and method is taught to those who seek the result in all tantras by means of the nature of cause and result.

original: dpal ldan dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od kyi rgyud la 'jug pa'i bshad sbyar brgya phrag bcu gsum pa mi g-yo ba'i snying po snang bar lam 'phrog pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa'i nges pa ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: dpal ldan dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od kyi rgyud la 'jug pa'i bshad sbyar brgya phrag bcu gsum pa mi g-yo ba'i snying po snang bar lam 'phrog pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa'i nges pa ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter, the explanation of the reason for the name of the thirteenth set of one hundred topics that illuminate the essence of Acala, the commentary on the glorious Stainless Light Tantra.

original: // / da ni gnyis med la sogs pa @59b bcu drug bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba can rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di nyid kyi go 'phang thob pa'i ched du rim pa ji lta bar rnal 'byor ma'i zhabs dran pas thig le bcu drug gi
analyzed: // / da ni gnyis med la sogs pa @59b bcu drug bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba can rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di nyid kyi go 'phang thob pa'i ched du rim pa ji lta bar rnal 'byor ma'i zhabs dran pas thig le bcu drug gi
translated: Now, in order to attain the state of this very glorious Wheel of Time, the vajra yoga that has sixteen divisions such as nonduality, the sixteen bindus are taught to be the means of pacifying the great fear of the obscurations that afflict the yogi's feet.

original: sgrib pa 'jigs pa chen po'i nye bar 'tshe ba zhi bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa 'jigs pa chen po'i nye bar 'tshe ba zhi bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The obscurations are taught to be pacified by the recollection of the feet of the yoginis.

original: snying rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins, Compassion, emptiness, and so on.

original: snying rje dang stong pa nyid dag ma phyed pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sku 'di'i yin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang stong pa nyid dag ma phyed pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sku 'di'i yin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The body that is illustrated by the nondifferentiation of compassion and emptiness is of this one.

original: snying rje ni dmigs pa med pa'i dus shes pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni dmigs pa med pa'i dus shes pa ste /
translated: Compassion is the consciousness of the time of the absence of an object.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba dang ye shes dang thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa kun rdzob gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba dang ye shes dang thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa kun rdzob gzugs can ma'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of unchanging bliss, gnosis, method, and compassion is the conventional form goddess.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid rdul phra rab med pa'i ngo bo 'khor lo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid rdul phra rab med pa'i ngo bo 'khor lo zhes pa ste /
translated: The emptiness that has an object, the nature of the absence of the most subtle particle, is the wheel.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa'i 'gro 'khor lo //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa'i 'gro 'khor lo //
translated: The wheel of the progression of the aspects of the knowable.🔽The glorious wisdom, the nature of emptiness,

original: dpal ldan shes rab stong nyid bdag / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan shes rab stong nyid bdag / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is explained as follows.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / dus kyi 'khor lo gnyis med 'dod //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dus kyi 'khor lo gnyis med 'dod //
translated: the Wheel of Time is asserted to be nondual.

original: ces so // gnyis su med pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di'i dpal 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ces so // gnyis su med pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di'i dpal 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: This glorious Wheel of Time, whose nature is nondual wisdom and method, is the glorious mundane and supramundane perfections, which are characterized by the benefit for oneself and others.

original: de thob pa'i ched du rnal 'byor ma rnams te rdo rje'i dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa rnams dang aa wa dh'u t'i la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de thob pa'i ched du rnal 'byor ma rnams te rdo rje'i dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa rnams dang aa wa dh'u t'i la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In order to attain that, there are the yoginis, such as Vajradhatvisvari, and the avadhuti, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi zhabs bsgom par bya zhes pa kha cig tu gzhan gyi ched kyi tshig can la bdag gi ched kyi tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhabs bsgom par bya zhes pa kha cig tu gzhan gyi ched kyi tshig can la bdag gi ched kyi tshig go //
translated: The feet of those are to be meditated upon.

original: bgegs nyams pa ni dgra dang seng ge la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba zhi ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs nyams pa ni dgra dang seng ge la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba zhi ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The pacification of obstacles is the pacification of the harm of enemies, lions, and so on.

original: bgegs zhi ba de nyid mdor bstan pa gsungs pa dgra dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs zhi ba de nyid mdor bstan pa gsungs pa dgra dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The brief teaching of the pacification of obstacles is stated by “enemies” and so forth.

original: 'dir rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig mtshan dang nyin du rnal 'byor ma 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig mtshan dang nyin du rnal 'byor ma 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Here, any son or daughter of good lineage, day and night, without interruption, of the yoginīs,

original: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad pa la ste zhabs kyang dran par byed pa de'i gsal bar te nges par dgra dang seng ge la sogs pa rnams nyams pa ste mthong ba med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o /

translated: and also the word “also” is for a different order, and also the feet are remembered, that is, certainly the enemies, lions, and so forth, are destroyed, that is, not seen.

translated: Now, the extensive explanation by means of the sixteen verses that pacify the sixteen great fears is stated by “elephants” and so forth.

original: glang chen ni glang po che'o //
analyzed: glang chen ni glang po che'o //
translated: Elephants are elephants.

original: shing rta ni shing rta rnams so //
analyzed: shing rta ni shing rta rnams so //
translated: Chariots are chariots.

original: rta ni rlung ltar mgyogs pa'i rta'o //
analyzed: rta ni rlung ltar mgyogs pa'i rta'o //
translated: Horses are horses that are swift as the wind.

original: mi ni @60a * //🔽dpung bu chung rnams so //
analyzed: mi ni @60a * //🔽dpung bu chung rnams so //
translated: Men are infantry.

original: sha ra bha ni ri brags so //

analyzed: de'i lam ni bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag drug gi dbugs 'bab pa'o //

translated: The yogis and yoginīs know that those nāḍīs, which are on the right, left, and in the center, go in stages and end above.🔽Well then, since there are other nāḍīs that are the principal ones of the body, voice, and mind, it is appropriate to explain them.

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //

translated: Although this is true, because they are applied to a single path, they are not explained as having the nature of a single wisdom and method, because they are undeluded with respect to body, speech, and mind, and because they descend through the application of a single one in the places of birth and cessation. original: zhabs de dag dran par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhabs de dag dran par byed pa ste /
translated: Those feet are to be remembered.

analyzed: gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: This Bhagavān is gradually endowed with the thirty-two marks, and also with the body adorned with the eighty minor marks.

analyzed: rgya cher 'grel pa gang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob byed de rab tu thob par byed pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: is obtained by the yogis through this commentary,

analyzed: 'dir zhes pa rgyud la 'jug par ro //
translated: it is “here” in the Introduction to the Tantra.

original: rgyud la 'jug pa'i ngag nye bar bsdus nas dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i rgya cher 'grel 'di ni myur du ste ma 'gor bar ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par bri bar bya'o zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: rgyud la 'jug pa'i ngag nye bar bsdus nas dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i rgya cher 'grel 'di ni myur du ste ma 'gor bar ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par bri bar bya'o zhes sbrel lo //
translated: This commentary called the Stainless Light should be written down quickly, in whatever way that can be managed, without delay.

analyzed: log pa'i shes pa la sogs pa mun pa'i tshogs rab tu 'joms par byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it thoroughly destroys the mass of darkness of wrong knowledge and so forth,

analyzed: dri ma blo ngan pa'i skyon rnams gang gi 'od las bral ba'o zhes pa ste /
translated: it is free from the stains of bad thoughts.

analyzed: rgya cher 'grel gang las bzhi pa'i don gang la sogs pa'i gnas rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rab tu gyur pa yang 'di yin la /
translated: This commentary is also supreme because it illuminates the topics of the meaning of the fourth chapter and so forth.🔽Or, it is supreme because it illuminates from the light of the sixteen digits of the moon free from obscuration.

original: 'on te 'od zer zla pa'i cha bcu drug gi sgrib pa dang bral ba las gsal bar byed pa yang ngo zhes pas rgya cher 'grel gang gis 'od dri ma dang bral ba yin pa de ni de skad ces brjod do //

translated: This commentary is called Stainless Light because it is free from the stains of the light.

original: rgya cher 'grel gyi don dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba la zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi sgrib pa dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'i sngags pa sbyor ba de rgyu ci'i phyir zhe na bden te /

translated: The sixteen parts of the moon are the obscurations, and the mantra that illuminates the very dissimilarity of phenomena is the application. Why is that? It is true.

original: gang 'di phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku rgyal po zla ba bzang pos rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel stong phrag drug cu ba dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od ces bya ba mdzad pa de nyid /

translated: This very one, the emanation of Vajrapāṇi, King Sucandra, composed the root tantra’s commentary called Stainless Light, consisting of sixty thousand verses.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi sprul pa'i sku rgyal po padma dkar pos mtshan de kho nas stong phrag bcu gnyis rnams kyis yang dag par bsdus so zhes pa de'i phyir zla ba'i sbyor ba rigs te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi sprul pa'i sku rgyal po padma dkar pos mtshan de kho nas stong phrag bcu gnyis rnams kyis yang dag par bsdus so zhes pa de'i phyir zla ba'i sbyor ba rigs te /
translated: That very one, the emanation of Avalokiteśvara, King Pundarīka, compiled it with twelve thousand verses. Therefore, the application of the moon is reasonable.

original: phyi dang nang gi bag chags kyi sgrib pa spongs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bag chags kyi sgrib pa spongs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it abandons the obscurations of external and internal traces.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba bzang po yang 'di yin la zla ba yang 'di yin pas zla ba bzang po ste /
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba bzang po yang 'di yin la zla ba yang 'di yin pas zla ba bzang po ste /
translated: Since it is good and it is the moon, it is the good moon.🔽It is asserted that the stainless moon of the vajra disciples of all tathāgatas is the moon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyan pa por gyur pa rdo rje zla ba dri bral 'dod do zhes pa'i phyir rgya cher 'grel yang dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od ces bya ba'o zhes gnas so zhes rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu

translated: Therefore, the commentary is called Stainless Light.

translated: The second great chapter of the king of brief tantras, the Kālacakra, in the Stainless Light commentary, is the supreme destroyer of all māras and obstacles, the great summary of the path of the supreme deity and the true path.

original: sgra ni ngag rdzogs pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ni ngag rdzogs pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “is” should be seen as completing the sentence.

analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa 'dis snying po'i don la mi 'khrul pa'i nges pa bshad do //
translated: This [verse] explains the certainty of the meaning of the essence, which is not mistaken by this follower of the root tantra.

translated: The supreme deity of desire and the excellent path, which is said to destroy all demons and obstacles, expresses the certainty of the subject matter and purpose.

analyzed: stong phrag bcu gnyis pa zhes pa 'dis tshad kyi nges pa gsungs so //
translated: The twelve thousand expresses the certainty of the measure.

translated: The great commentary on the brief tantra of the Kālacakra Tantra expresses the certainty of the explanation of the commentary.

analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od ces pa 'dis ni mtshan gyi nges pa bstan to //

analyzed: nges pa zhes pa 'dis ni rnam pa gzhan du bya ba ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: The certainty expresses the teaching that it should not be done in another way.
